notes.text:
An update for freerdp is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. The xfreerdp client can connect to RDP servers such as Microsoft Windows machines, xrdp, and VirtualBox.

Security Fix(es):

* freerdp: Incorrect offset calculation leading to DOS (CVE-2023-39350)

* freerdp: Null Pointer Dereference leading DOS in RemoteFX (CVE-2023-39351)

* freerdp: invalid offset validation leading to Out Of Bound Write (CVE-2023-39352)

* freerdp: missing offset validation leading to Out-of-Bounds Read in gdi_multi_opaque_rect (CVE-2023-39356)

* freerdp: Integer overflow leading to out-of-bound write vulnerability in gdi_CreateSurface (CVE-2023-40186)

* freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in clear_decompress_bands_data (CVE-2023-40567)

* freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in the `progressive_decompress` function due to incorrect calculations (CVE-2023-40569)

* freerdp: buffer overflow in ncrush_decompress causes crash with crafted input (CVE-2023-40589)

* freerdp: missing offset validation leading to Out Of Bound Read (CVE-2023-39353)

* freerdp: Out-Of-Bounds Read in nsc_rle_decompress_data (CVE-2023-39354)

* freerdp: integer-Underflow leading to Out-Of-Bound Read in zgfx_decompress_segment (CVE-2023-40181)

* freerdp: Out-of-bounds read in general_LumaToYUV444 (CVE-2023-40188)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.4 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. When an insufficient blockLen value is provided and proper length validation is not performed, an Integer Underflow can occur, leading to a Denial of Service (DOS).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: Incorrect offset calculation leading to DOS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: Incorrect offset calculation leading to DOS

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. If the initialization process of tiles is incomplete, for various reasons, tiles will have a NULL pointer. This can be accessed in further processing, causing a program crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: Null Pointer Dereference leading DOS in RemoteFX
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: Null Pointer Dereference leading DOS in RemoteFX

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. An out-of-bounds write may occur when the values `rect->left` and `rect->top` are exactly equal to `surface->width` and  `surface->height`. eg. `rect->left` == `surface->width` && `rect->top` == `surface->height`. This issue can result in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: invalid offset validation leading to Out Of Bound Write
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: invalid offset validation leading to Out Of Bound Write

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. In the `libfreerdp/codec/rfx.c` file, there is no offset validation in `tile->quantIdxY`, `tile->quantIdxCb`, and `tile->quantIdxCr`. As a result, crafted input can lead to an out-of-bounds read, which may result in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: missing offset validation leading to Out Of Bound Read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: missing offset validation leading to Out Of Bound Read

notes.text: FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. Affected versions are subject to an Out-Of-Bounds Read in the `nsc_rle_decompress_data` function. The Out-Of-Bounds Read occurs because it processes `context->Planes` without  checking if it contains data of sufficient length. Should an attacker be able to leverage this vulnerability they may be able to cause a crash. This issue has been addressed in versions 2.11.0 and 3.0.0-beta3. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: Out-Of-Bounds Read in nsc_rle_decompress_data
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. Looping through `multi_opaque_rect->`numRectangles without proper boundary checks can lead to a heap-buffer-overflow, which may result in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: missing offset validation leading to Out-of-Bounds Read in gdi_multi_opaque_rect
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: missing offset validation leading to Out-of-Bounds Read in gdi_multi_opaque_rect

notes.text: FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. Affected versions are subject to an Integer-Underflow leading to Out-Of-Bound Read in the `zgfx_decompress_segment` function. In the context of `CopyMemory`, it's possible to read data beyond the transmitted packet range and likely cause a crash. This issue has been addressed in versions 2.11.0 and 3.0.0-beta3. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: integer-Underflow leading to Out-Of-Bound Read in zgfx_decompress_segment
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: integer-Underflow leading to Out-Of-Bound Read in zgfx_decompress_segment

notes.text: An integer overflow vulnerability was found in the `gdi_CreateSurface` function in FreeRDP, which may result in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: Integer overflow leading to out-of-bound write vulnerability in gdi_CreateSurface
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects FreeRDP based clients only. FreeRDP proxies are not affected as image decoding is not done by a proxy.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: freerdp: Integer overflow leading to out-of-bound write vulnerability in gdi_CreateSurface

notes.text: FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. Affected versions are subject to an Out-Of-Bounds Read in the `general_LumaToYUV444` function. This Out-Of-Bounds Read occurs because processing is done on the `in` variable without checking if it contains data of sufficient length. Insufficient data for the `in` variable may cause errors or crashes. This issue has been addressed in versions 2.11.0 and 3.0.0-beta3. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: Out-of-bounds read in general_LumaToYUV444

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. Improper validation in the `clear_decompress_bands_data` function may allow for an out-of-bounds write, resulting in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: A flaw was found in FreeRDP. Incorrect calculations in the `progressive_decompress` function may allow for a buffer overflow, resulting in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in the `progressive_decompress` function due to incorrect calculations
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Only FreeRDP based clients are affected. FreeRDP proxy is not affected as image decoding is not done by proxy.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A flaw was found in the FreeRDP implementation. Feeding crafted input into the ncrush_decompress function may cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freerdp: buffer overflow in ncrush_decompress causes crash with crafted input
